definition: to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to steal/to pilfer/to snatch/thief/stealthily
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: Everyone around here knows that he's a man on the sly.
sentences.chinese: 咱們這兒的人都曉得他是個偷雞摸狗的人。

sentences.english: Don't keep in touch with he, he is a man on the sly.
sentences.chinese: 周圍的每個人都知道他是偷雞摸狗的人。

sentences.english: Nobody has the excuse of 'lack of money' for not being at peace and living in integrity.
sentences.chinese: “不能把“沒錢”作爲不安以及偷雞摸狗的藉口。

sentences.english: The world doesn’t need another drama about adultery.
sentences.chinese: 這個世界也用不着戲劇去表演偷雞摸狗的勾當了。

sentences.english: Why don't y'all get in the car and I'll run you up there.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不偷雞摸狗上車，我將會向你奔去，你上去。

sentences.english: He is a men who is on the sly.
sentences.chinese: 周圍每一個人度知道他是個偷雞摸狗的人。

definition: to play deaf-mute
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to force someone to do something
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
idle gossip
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
to prevail upon/to coax
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
red in the face/extremely angry
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
